sections.1_story_intuition: Biology is the study of living organisms, including humans, plants, and diseases. Understanding basic biology is crucial for competitive exams, as questions often focus on the human body, plant systems, and common diseases relevant to daily life and health.
2_key_definitions: Cell: Basic structural and functional unit of life.
Tissue: Group of similar cells performing a specific function.
Organ: Structure made of tissues performing a specific task.
Photosynthesis: Process by which plants make food using sunlight.
Respiration: Process of energy production in living cells.
Immunity: Body's ability to resist diseases.
Vaccine: Substance that provides immunity against diseases.
Antibody: Protein produced by the body to fight pathogens.
Hormone: Chemical messenger regulating body functions.
3_key_facts_data_points: Blood is red due to hemoglobin.
Chlorophyll gives green color to plants.
AIDS is caused by HIV virus.
Diabetes is due to lack of insulin.
Goiter is caused by iodine deficiency.
4_micro_notes: Cell is the basic unit of life.
5_exam_capsules: What is the basic unit of life? Cell.
How many bones in human body? 206.
What is the largest organ? Skin.
What is the smallest bone? Stapes.
What carries oxygen in blood? Hemoglobin.
What is the normal body temperature? 98.6¬∞F (37¬∞C).
What gives plants green color? Chlorophyll.
What causes diabetes? Lack of insulin.
7_traps_confusing_points: Confusing artery (away from heart) and vein (towards heart).
Mixing up xylem and phloem functions.
Mixing up number of bones in adults and children.
Confusing deficiency diseases and infectious diseases.

8_case_study_context.title: Malaria and Its Prevention
8_case_study_context.explanation: Malaria is caused by Plasmodium parasite, transmitted by female Anopheles mosquito. Prevention includes using mosquito nets, eliminating stagnant water, and taking antimalarial drugs. Vaccination and awareness are key to control.
